temples.name: Lima Peru
address: Av. Javier Prado Este 6420, Urb. Santa Patricia, La Molina, Lima 12, Peru
email: Follow Link, sign in if needed, scroll down to email, click link and follow instructions

history.One_Liner: The first of two temples in Lima Peru will together with the second make Lima the third city in the world to have two temples, right after South Jordan and Provo!
history.Full_Paragraph: With only 10,000 sq feet of indoor space, the Peru Lima Temple serves more than 400,000 members in the area 'cercano,' meaning close or nearby. This temple design is actually quite common. Have you seen it before? Gordon B. Hinckley announced many temples quite quickly and many of them were given this design layout.

temples.name: Papeete Tahiti
address: Temple S.D.J. (Mormon) Allee Pierre Loti Papeete, Tahiti 98716, French Polynesia
email: Follow Link, sign in if needed, scroll down to email, click link and follow instructions

history.One_Liner: Announced April 2nd, 1980, the Papeete Tahiti Temple is the 25th operating Temple in the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints!
history.Full_Paragraph: Located in the city of Papeete, the Papeete Tahiti Temple is the only temple for over 14 hundred miles! The single spire design was a modern design at the time. The temple was dedicated October 27th, 1983 by Gordon B. Hinckley and rededicated November 12, 2006 by Apostle L. Tom Perry. An estimated 10,000 Tahitians participated in the rededication along with others invited via satelite broadcast.

temples.name: Oakland California
address: 4770 Lincoln Ave, Oakland CA 94602-2535, United States
email: Follow Link, sign in if needed, scroll down to email, click link and follow instructions

history.One_Liner: With half a million lights glowing around the Christmas season, the Oakland California Temple and grounds can be seen all the way from the San Francisco Bay!
history.Full_Paragraph: Designed with a combination of Art Deco, and Asian elements, the temple has become a local landmark. Built on 18.3 Acres of land it has room for a Tri-Stake center, Visitor's center and a fountain that runs all the way down from the Temple itself to the end of the walkway, nearly twice as long as the temple itself! The Visitor's center also has a Family History center on the basement level.

temples.name: Manila Philippines
address: 13 Temple Drive corner Whiteplains Avenue, Greenmeadows Subdivision, UGONG NORTE, Quezon City, 1110 Metro Manila, Philippines
email: Follow Link, sign in if needed, scroll down to email, click link and follow instructions

history.One_Liner: 23 years after the country was dedicated by Gordon B. Hinckley, the Manila Philippines Temple was dedicated. Oh what a joy this must have been!
history.Full_Paragraph: 'Beginning on December 2, 1989, during the 1989 Philippine coup attempt, rebel forces briefly occupied the temple grounds and some surrounding auxiliary buildings. Dignardino Espi, director of temple security at the time, convinced the rebels not to enter the temple itself. Following a standoff with government troops, the rebels vacated the area on December 4. The temple suffered only superficial damage during the incident.' (Quoted from the 'read more link' below.
